what.lead: Empower Members of the European Parliament to fully represent citizens’interests
what.text: by being able to propose bills. As the only directly-elected EU institution, the European Parliament must be given the right to initiate legislation – just like national parliaments.

what.lead: Ensure that the work of the Parliament is fully transparent and prevent last-minute rewrites and back-room deals.
what.text: Record and make public all votes of Members of the European Parliament, and ensure a fixed time span for public review of bills before they are voted on.

what.lead: Ensure fair representation of all EU citizens
what.text: and strengthen the link between citizens and their representatives. This can be ensured by implementing the same voting rules for the European Parliament elections across the EU and by having citizens locally elect their Members of the European Parliament, whilst ensuring proportionality.
